intro: Pedicularis membranacea, commonly known as the membranous lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, membranous sheath. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
